Name: Glass sherd
Description: Blue glass sherd: a honeycomb pattern has been cut into the surface of the sherd, in a style not usual before the Islamic Period. In the absence of archaeological context, its interest lies in the date of acquisition, as part of the collection of antiquities formed by Lady Harriet Kavanagh. Her collection with its inventory provides a rare example of a well-documented private group of materials from the 1840s.
